reporting-org.narrative: Environmental Centre for Oil Spills and Gas Flaring (NACGOND)

title.narrative: Sensitization in Ogoni land to forestall violence that may arise during the environmental clean-up and restoration work by HYPREP.

description.narrative: Undertake advocacy for peaceful engagement in Ogoni land for the purpose of an effective clean-up.

participating-org.narrative: Centre for Environment Human Rights and Development (CEHRD)
Movement for the Survival of the Ogoni People (MOSOP)

activity-date.narrative: Activity started in 2016 and lasted for 3 years.

organisation.narrative: National Coordinator of NACGOND is responsible for all inquiries concerning the project.

recipient-country.narrative: Activity was implemented in 13 Ogoni communities in Rivers State, Nigeria.

sector.narrative: Activity was funded by the Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands, Abuja, Nigeria

condition.narrative: Activity was measured based on the peaceful atmosphere in the 13 sensitized Ogoni communities after environmental clean up and restoration work had been concluded.

title.narrative: Result was measured based on the peaceful atmosphere in 13 communities of Ogoniland where activity was implemented and certified by regulatory authority.

description.narrative: Community members needed to understand how to relate with the structures of government especially HYPREP in the important task of clean-up and restoration of polluted sites in Ogoni communities ravaged by the oil and gas industry activities. Tackling misconceptions about the project funds seen to bring about the breakdown of peace was perceived as necessary to the cleanup process of Ogoniland. In the buildup to the clean-up process, misconceptions abound about the intervention and what the budgeted fund was actually meant for so winning the cooperation of the local people to support the project with the pre-existing conditions was important to the success of the entire process.

title.narrative: Video evidence showing testimonials from project beneficiaries

description.narrative: Thirteen (13) Ogoni communities were sensitized to remain peaceful during and after the environmental cleanup exercise of the Federal Government of Nigeria.

title.narrative: Number of conflicts defused in the thirteen (13) sensitised communities of Ogoniland.

description.narrative: Because of the political undertone, existence of divergent positions on the clean-up process in Ogoniland may destabilize the exercise.

baseline.value: Significantly held divergent views among community persons in the 13 Ogoni communities.

location.ref: 13 communities out of the entire Ogoni communities mapped for remediation.

dimension.name: Community chiefs, youths, women and gate keepers.
dimension.value: Chiefs, youths, women and youths constituted main demographic sets most vulneable to the ensued conflict.

comment.narrative: Forestalling violence that may have arose during the clean-up in Ogoniland was seen as a boost for an effective clean-up exercise in Ogoniland.

target.value: Ensure peaceful atmosphere during and after clean up excercise.

location.ref: 13 Communities of Ogoniland in 4 Local Government Areas of Rivers State Where environmental clean up and restoration work was done by HYPREP.

dimension.name: Prior to the commencement of Ogoni environmental clean-up and restoration exercise, cult related violence, pipeline vandalism, oil theft, artisanal refining activities, chieftaincy tussles and kidnapping incidences threatened the peaceful cleanup exercise of the Federal Government.
dimension.value: Peaceful clean up of sensitised communities was achieved as a result of implemented activity.

comment.narrative: Both community persons and relevant state agencies who were interviewed corroborated the relevance of sensitization campaigns to forestall violence in the thirteen (13) communities of Ogoniland because of the sensitive nature of the clean-up exercise to the communities, the state and the environment.

actual.value: About 80% of project communities cooperated with the exercise which has been going on peacefully with post remediation certification carried out successfully in 1 out of the 13 sensitised communities of Ogoniland.

location.ref: 13 communities in 4 Local Government Areas of Ogoni in Rivers State, Nigeria.

dimension.name: Implemented activities in Ogoniland have not only ensured peaceful clean-up exercise by HYPREP but have also created conducive environment for empowerment of community persons especially women and youths through direct engagements in contract jobs awarded as well as other on-going human capital, health and social development projects in peaceful communities of Ogoniland.
dimension.value: Peace was sustained in the communities during and after the clean up and restoration work.

comment.narrative: Advocacy campaigns carried out by NACGOND implementing partners in 13 Ogoni communities to forestall violence before, during and after the cleanup of polluted sites by HYPREP has ensured sustained peace in the communities with post remediation certification sampling ongoing in lots 14, 19 and 20 in one of the sensitized communities.
